strapiPost.title: University of Arkansas Ranks High In Value Of MBA Program
strapiPost.content:
A recent study by The Wall Street Journal ranked Walton College of Business at the U of A 11th out of 600 programs regarding return on investment in earning an MBA.

  • Value added: Walton MBA students borrow an average of $28K for the program and earn an average of $106K two years later, resulting in a debt-to-income ratio of 0.26, and considering the cost of living in NWA makes that advantage even more remarkable.
  • Get ahead: With an innovative curriculum taught by world-renowned faculty and unparalleled networking opportunities through corporate connections in the region, Walton College provides opportunities for full-time MBA students as well as opportunities for working professionals to further their education.

Learn more about Walton College of Business HERE.
